result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas M. Schelvan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (<=200g) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Maintain full time employment or maintain school schedule and employment to equal full time.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Obtain all prescriptions from a single pharmacy.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription from a MD physician and be taken only according to the prescription.
Provide authorization to agent for agent to obtain pharmacy records to monitor.
Comply with other necessary treatment and counseling as recommended by the agent.
Provide DNA Sample.
Pay $300 reimburse of Drug Buy Money (Plover PD).

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nicholas M. Schelvan in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:09 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

Court has a signed Plea questionnaire/Agreement.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to single count in information.
State recommends an imposed and stayed sentence. Defense is free to argue.

Atty Schmidt concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Schmidt for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CF-4: Found Guilty

Atty Molepske makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Schmidt makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing. Court states concerns.
Defendant replies.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1:
Prison Sentence of 3 Years, Imposed and Stayed
Initial Confinement of 1.5 Years
Extended Supervision of 1.5 Years
Eligible for substance abuse program
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $300 plus costs
Pay $300 cost (buy money to be awareded to Village of Plover Police Dept)
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Drug Abuse Surcharge
AODA and comply with treatment recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety
Obtain all prescriptions from a single pharmacy
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription from a MD physician and be taken only according to the prescription
Provide authorization to agent for agent to obtain pharmacy records to monitor
Maintain full time employment or maintain school schedule and employment to equal full time
Comply with other necessary treatment and counseling as recommended by the agent
Conditional Jail Sentence for a period of 6 Months
Sawyer County will accept transfer as long as Court can assure it that it won't incur any additional costs
Huber granted for work only
Provide DNA Sample


Atty Molepske addresses buy money.
Atty Schmidt addresses huber. 
Atty Molpekse clarifies huber and dna sample and consequences.

Court addresses Defendant regarding consequences.
Defendant Record Update
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference at 03-07-2016 09:00 am
filed by the State

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing at 03-07-2016 09:00 am

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.
